New Records: England became the first men's team to hold the T20 and ODI World Cups simultaneously
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes scored the winning run, Jos Buttler was dismissed in the powerplay, Harry Brook was caught by Shaheen Afridi, Moeen Ali hit two boundaries in the 16th over
Pre-Game Insights: The forecasters got it wrong and England got it right, the predicted downpour held off
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes was named the player of the match, Jos Buttler hailed England's heroics, the team became unarguably one of the great white-ball sides in the history of the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shaheen Afridi took a catch but hurt himself in the process, Pakistan's chances of victory disappeared after the first six overs, Naseem Shah terrorised England's batters with a remarkable spell of fast bowling
Others: Adil Rashid and Sam Curran performed outstandingly with the ball, the game remained finely balanced until the 13th over, Liam Livingstone took three catches at deep midwicket
